articles.title: About this site
articles.description: Some additional details about the website
articles.contents:
R can be fun to teach and learn.
I have planned these lessons to teach my year 9 girls who are very enthusiastic to learn how to build their website using R coding.
The steps are easy to follow and simple.
Enjoy building your own website.üòÑ

articles.contents:
We are delighted to announce that we are setting up a worldwide network to promote the use of R - a leading data science programming language - in secondary schools for girls.
Visit our website

articles.title: Lessons
articles.contents: Contents Lesson 1 Learning Objectives Step 1: Sign in on Positcloud Step 2: Open Github account Step 3: Name it Step 4: Clone repo Step 5: New project Step 6: Setup R Step 7: Install distill Step 7: Create website Lesson 2 Learning objectives: Step 1: Choose layout Step 2: Delete old index file Step 3:Create layout Step 4: Add images to R Add video (from YouTube) to R Step 5: Insert all your information into pages Step 6: To insert emoji Lesson 3 Learning objectives: Step 1: Adding more pages to your website Step 2: Add icons to buttons Step 3: For links to open in new page (see above pic) Step 4: To push to Github Lesson 4 Learning objectives: Stage 1:Create new theme -> css file Step 2: Change our font Step 3: Choose color palette Step 6: After making all the changes you want save on github Lesson 5 Learning objectives: Step 1: Copy this code at the bottom of css file Step2: And now copy this code underneath to change button colours Step 3: Menu bar (dropdown) Lesson 1 Learning Objectives Opening an account at Github Opening a new repository and naming it Getting code from Github and creating a new R project Installing package (‚Äúdistill‚Äù) Create website Step 1: Sign in on Positcloud Step 2: Open Github account Open an account with Github. Create a new repository Step 3: Name it Be careful as this name will be part of your website Tick readme box Step 4: Clone repo Copy the code at Github (the URL) green code button and copy URL Step 5: New project Go to R positcloud and open new project (from Git Repository) Add the code that you copied at Github Step 6: Setup R Open R and change view settings and appearance. Tools-> global options > R markdown > view in viewer pane Step 7: Install distill Close and open project again Install ‚Äúdistill‚Äù using this code (type in console) install.packages("distill") click enter Then type this code library(distill) click enter Go to packages and check if there is a ‚Äòtick‚Äô next to the distill box Step 7: Create website Type this code in consule, write the name of your website create_website(dir = ".", title ="name of your website", gh_pages = TRUE) First change the title of your website and then click ‚Äúenter‚Äù to run code Your website is now ready to view. We will learn about layouts next lesson. Lesson 2 Learning objectives: Find a good layout for your website Change the title at yaml Add video link and images to pages Change layout of text Add emoji to website Step 1: Choose layout Choose a layout/template from this website Seankross postcards Add this code to console: install.packages("postcards") Step 2: Delete old index file Tick index.rmd in files Delete index.rmd file in the ‚ÄòFile‚Äô tab Step 3:Create layout Add this code to console with your chosen template create_article(file ="index", template= "trestles", package = "postcards") Click on index.rmd from the file list on the right of screen Go to top left window Copy this code and paste after output in new line: site: distill::distill_website ‚Ä¢ This creates the template for the homepage ‚Ä¢ Now this is our new homepage ‚Ä¢ Change title ‚Ä¢ Knit to see a preview of just the homepage Step 4: Add images to R Go to bottom right window ‚ÄúFiles‚Äù Make a new folder and name it ‚ÄúImages‚Äù Upload any pictures inside folder Change image ‚Äúimages/name of image.jpg‚Äù on top of index.rmd page. To add picture on any page use this format: ![title of image](images/name of pic.jpg) Add video (from YouTube) to R Open a Youtube video Click ‚Äúshare‚Äù and then ‚Äúembed‚Äù then copy code Add code to your page Step 5: Insert all your information into pages Change layout of page using these symbols For title (bigger font) use # biggest ,## smaller, ### smaller For bold use ** before and after ** For italics use * before and after * Step 6: To insert emoji Run this code install.packages("devtools") then this devtools::install_github("hadley/emo") Now you can add emoji like this: `r emo::ji("smile")` For more names visit this page Lesson 3 Learning objectives: Add new pages to your website Add icons to buttons Push changes to Github Step 1: Adding more pages to your website Go to site.yml Now copy ( text and href) of ‚Äòabout‚Äô Paste underneath and rename it Use this code to make new page create_article(‚Äúname") exactly same as href ![](images/Picture10.png) Step 2: Add icons to buttons Go to R girls school Click github and then website Go to index.rmd Copy codes and paste on your index page - label: '< i class="fab fa-twitter"> Twitter' url: 'https://twitter.com/R_Girls_School target="_blank"' - label: '< i class="fab fa-github"> GitHub' url: 'https://github.com/R-Girls target="_blank"' - label: '< i class="fas fa-envelope">< /i> Contact Us' url: "mailto:maryam.nawaz@greenoak.bham.sch.uk" ![](images/Picture11.png) Other available icons-> Go to website search and copy code Step 3: For links to open in new page (see above pic) In Url first remove ‚Äú ‚Äù to single ‚Äò ‚Äô Add target="_blank" after codes in URL. Inside the ‚Äô ‚Äô Step 4: To push to Github install.packages("usethis") usethis::use_git_config(user.name= "msnawaz9",user.email= "maryam.nawaz@greenoak.bham.sch.uk") use your own login details Enter in console usethis::create_github_token() and get token from Github (90 days) Enter in console gitcreds::gitcreds_set() Enter password or token: insert password here Go to Git -> Add a message and click commit -> Click push Your website should have updated on Github On Github: Go to settings -> Pages -> change branch main to /docs Then view your website as its online now Lesson 4 Learning objectives: Create a css file for theme Import google fonts Import colours for layout Stage 1:Create new theme -> css file Add this code to console create_theme(‚Äúmy-theme‚Äù) On _Site.yml add line of code after output_dir: theme: my_theme.css Step 2: Change our font Import google fonts from this website Search for fav font and select @import copy the code in between the style tags < style> Now add at the top of css file all the fonts you want to use. Customise !!!! Add more fonts that you want to use for your website Font sizes (example) Title size = 40px Body size = 18px Code size = 16px Always knit to see pages until you are happy with font type and size Step 3: Choose color palette Go to coolers website Make a palette and download for later use. You can lock colors or press space bar for new colors You can export to pdf (HEX and RGB) To change the banner at the top of website go to coding section (my_theme.css file) as shown in pic and here you can change : Example Title size = 28px (how big do you want the banner to be) Text color = what colour do you want the text to be Text size = 28px (size of text) Hover color = white (when you move mouse over the writing what colour should it change into) Background color = #C34A79 (The colour of the banner) Step 6: After making all the changes you want save on github Commit- push to save on website Lesson 5 Learning objectives: Changing the font colours Change button colours Include a navigation bar Add table of contents Step 1: Copy this code at the bottom of css file h1 { color: #C34A79; font-size: 36px; } Now you can change the colour and font size of your biggest header on website Step2: And now copy this code underneath to change button colours .btn-outline-dark { background-color: transparent; color: rgba(195, 74, 121); border: 1px solid; border-color: rgba(195, 74, 121); } .btn-outline-dark:hover { background-color: rgba(195, 74, 121); border-color: rgba(195, 74, 121); color: white; } Now you change colours of button using coolers.co website. Also look at R Grils github for further codes. Step 3: Menu bar (dropdown) Go to _Site.yml The menu argument allows you to add dropdown options so the main button will say lesson plans and then you can have the choice to pick which type of lesson plan Make sure the spaces are properly formatted or you‚Äôll get an error (even one tab off on menu as example) Note: the links won‚Äôt work yet because we haven‚Äôt created the pages yet
